justification: "The Go/No-Go (GNG) task examines the capacity to suppress prepotent responses … This method assesses response inhibition by requiring participants to respond quickly to certain stimuli (Go) while withholding responses to others (No-Go)."

topic_or_construct: ability to suppress ongoing motor responses
justification: "The Stop-Signal task (SST) measures the ability to suppress ongoing motor responses … the SST has become a widely used paradigm in cognitive psychology and neuroscience."

"The AAT typically involves participants responding to stimuli by either pulling a joystick towards themselves (approach) or pushing it away (avoidance)… The task measures the automatic tendencies to approach positive stimuli and avoid negative ones."

measured_by: Cue-Approach Training (CAT) paradigm with subsequent binary forced-choice probe
justification: "In the original CAT task, the mere association of snack food pictures with a neutral auditory cue and a speeded motor response led to enhanced preferences… Preference change was measured in a subsequent binary choice phase."
